dublin_core.dcvalue: Digital Health Lessons from Other Fields Digital health innovations from other fields bring important learnings to global health From MEASURE Evaluation you will learn how Geographical Information Systems GIS were used to develop a Service Transformation Plan in Mpumalanga Province South Africa that creates a new paradigm for service delivery in the public health sector that will optimally utilise human and capital resources and harness the large potential that exists in the private sector From the African Alliance of Digital Health Networks you will learn how local knowledge can be used to design a digital health strategy illustrated through experiences implementing digital health policies in areas struggling with internet connection as well as introducing mobile banking and eLearning in mining towns in the Democratic Republic of Congo and South Africa And from IntraHealth you will learn how technology sector leaders like Google and Facebook are driving user engagement via critical lessons about how to make the most of poor infrastructure expensive prepaid data plans and basic devices which can be used to improve RFPs for software development Presented by Richard Stanley Technical Advisor Digital Health IntraHealth International

Made available in DSpace on 2020-06-22T10:36:36Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 1 richard_stanley_-_happy_users_better_data_rstanley_12042017.pdf: 1982130 bytes, checksum: 9be495ea355876dd26441694b2b628ac (MD5)
How to Have Happier Users and Better Data with Faster Apps
